choices.C: The minimum delay along the path is used.
choices.A: The mean value of bandwidth between the source and destination is used.
choices.D: The maximum delay along the path is used. C
choices.B: The minimum bandwidth between the source and destination is used.

questions.question_text: Which statement about the metric calculation in EIGRP is true?

discussion.content:
c,
Router which owns directly connected route and advertises it in EIGRP, includes directly connected interface bandwidth and delay in EIGRP Update packet. Directly connected neighbor (the 2nd router) gets this Update message and compares its receiving interface bandwidth with the value present in Update message --> lowest is used in formula from receiving router point of view. This second router also computes sum of its interface delay and delay present in Update message --> result is used in formula from receiving router point of view.

Besides, using these 2 values (sum of delay and lowest bandwidth) in local route computation, router sends these values to its own neighbors

B

When the IP SLAs responder is enabled, it allows the target device to take time stamps when the packet arrives on the interface at interrupt level and again just as it is leaving, eliminating the processing time. This time stamping is made with a granularity of sub-milliseconds (ms).

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3560/software/release/12-2_58_se/configuration/guide/3560scg/swipsla.html

questions.question_text:
A network administrator is attempting to configure IP SLA to allow one time stamp to be logged when a packet arrives on the interface and one time stamp to be logged when a packet leaves the interface.
Which IP SLA accuracy tool enables this functionality?
Which two effects of asymmetric routing are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
TCP MSS as described earlier takes care of fragmentation at the two endpoints of a TCP connection, but it does not handle the case where there is a smaller MTU link in the middle between these two endpoints. PMTUD was developed in order to avoid fragmentation in the path between the endpoints. It is used to dynamically determine the lowest MTU along the path from a packet's source to its destination.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/generic-routing-encapsulation-gre/25885-pmtud-ipfrag.html#anc6

TCP MSS take care the endpoints fragment
PMTUD take care the path fragment
The correct answer is TCP MSS
